ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Test of ...
ygData.msgSnippet: My guild held a joust in the PVP area of Qeynos.  It was a friendly event, casters vs melee.  Casters were defined as anyone who can bind .  Everyone else
ygData.messageBody:
My guild held a "joust" in the PVP area of Qeynos. It
was a friendly event, casters vs melee. Casters were
defined as "anyone who can bind". Everyone else is a
melee class.

Simple, but it worked out well.


--- Adam Wasserman <wassermana@...> wrote:
> I logged in this Sunday and saw that the MoTD was
> announcing the coming of
> the Test of Flight on my server. The MoTD also said
> that we should go to
> everquest.com
> (http://everquest.station.sony.com/everquest_h.html)
> and get
> the details on the event, so I went.
>
> Well, it turns out that the test of flight is an
> archery contest. It looks
> fun, but as a bard, I cannot compete, because,
> despite the discover of a
> bard usable bow, there are no arrows we can use. So
> I was poking around on
> the same events page to see what else was up and
> comming that I could
> participate in.
>
> Test of Steel... Nope.
> Warrior, Monk, Paladin, Ranger and Shadow Knights
> are the only ones who can
> enter.
>
> Test of Mystics... Nope.
> Necromancer, Wizards, Mages and Enchanters only.
>
> Test of Faith... Nope.
> Clerics, Paladins, Druids and Shamen only.
>
> So basically, I found out that there is an event for
> every single class,
> except for bards. I was a little disappointed that I
> am unable to compete in
> any of these events merely because Verant has no
> idea where bards belong in
> the grand scheme of things.
>
> I was gonna post all of this to the EQ message
> boards, but I wanted to see
> if you guys had any input first. I'm generally
> opposed to whiny posts, and
> I'm sure that regardless of how I word my
> disatisfaction, that is how it
> will be construed.
>
> Draelon Stormsong
> Bard of the Tribunal
> [2 levels to planar capability]
>
